Requirement Description: Capture client personal and financial data
Perform KYC and AML compliance checks
Enable risk profiling and suitability assessment
Support digital consent and e-signatures
Automate account creation post approval
Allow client to register/login
Upload documents with OCR & duplicate check
OCR extraction with >80% confidence validation
Check uploaded docs for duplicates
Perform AML/KYC screening
Conduct risk questionnaire and generate score
Capture client digital consent
Enable client to sign documents digitally
Automate account opening in core banking
Sync client data to CRM
Provide Ops dashboard for exceptions
System must handle 500 concurrent onboardings
System must encrypt all PII with AES-256
System must log all actions with timestamps
APIs must respond within 3s avg
Support browsers: Chrome, Edge, Safari (latest 2 versions)
System shall respond to user login requests within 2 seconds (avg).
Document upload endpoint shall accept and acknowledge files within 3 seconds.
KYC screening request shall return within 5 seconds under normal conditions.
Support at least 500 concurrent onboardings and 1,000 TPS across services.
Overall platform availability shall be ? 99.95%.
All PII at rest shall be encrypted with AES?256; keys rotated quarterly.
All data in transit shall use TLS 1.3 with strong ciphers.
Enforce MFA for RM/Admin roles; session timeout after 15 minutes idle.
Rate limiting shall prevent abuse on public APIs.
System shall comply with GDPR (consent, DSAR, right to erasure).
FATCA/CRS data capture and reporting accuracy ? 99.5%.
All actions shall be logged with user, timestamp, IP, entity and outcome.
RPO ? 15 minutes and RTO ? 1 hour for critical services.
Emit standardized metrics, logs and traces for all services.
WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility compliance for client-facing UI.
Support English at launch; framework ready for multilingual with i18n keys.
Microservices must have test coverage ? 80% lines/branches.
Mean time to detect (MTTD) ? 5 min; mean time to recover (MTTR) ? 30 min.
UI pages (SPA) shall have LCP ? 2.5s on 4G, 95th percentile.
KYC documents retained per policy (e.g., 7 years) with legal hold support.
Design Reference: Section Data Retention in NFR Matrix

Requirement Description: APIs follow OpenAPI 3.0; consistent error model and versioning.
Document store sized for 5 TB Y1 with 30% headroom.
Mask PII in non?prod and logs; use synthetic/anonymized data.
User?facing errors must be friendly with correlation IDs.
Design Reference: Section Error Handling in NFR Matrix

Requirement Description: Asynchronous jobs retry with backoff; DLQ on final failure.
System uses UTC; time?zone rendering per user locale in UI.
Secrets managed in vault; no secrets in code or CI logs.
Graceful degradation when external vendors fail.
